metadata.description:
The data set contains meteorological observation data of zhangye wetland station in the middle reaches of heihe hydrometeorological observation network from January 1, 2014 to December 31, 2014.The site is located in zhangye national wetland park in gansu province.The latitude and longitude of the observation point is 100.4464E, 38.9751N, and altitude is 1460m.Air temperature and relative humidity sensors are set up at 5m and 10m, facing due north.The barometer is installed at 2m;The inverted bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;The wind speed sensor is set up at 5m and 10m, and the wind direction sensor is set up at 10m, facing due north.The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;The two infrared thermometers are installed at the position of 6m, facing south, and the probe is facing vertically downward.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm and 40cm underground, in the south due to 2m from the meteorological tower.The soil hot flow plates (3) are successively buried in the ground 6cm;Four photosynthetic radiometers are installed above and inside the canopy respectively. The upper part of the canopy is installed at 6m (one probe vertically up and one probe vertically down), and the upper part of the canopy is installed at 0.25m (one probe vertically up and one probe vertically down), facing due south.
Observation items are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m RH_5m Ta_10m, RH_10m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_5m, WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:Degrees Celsius), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts per square meter), soil temperature (Ts_0cm Ts_2cm Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm) (unit: c), the canopy on the up and down photosynthetic active radiation (PAR_U_up, PAR_U_down) (unit: second micromoles/m2) and up and down under canopy photosynthetic active radiation (PAR_D_up, PAR_D_down) (unit: second micromoles/m2).
Processing and quality control of observation data :(1) ensure 144 data per day (every 10min). If data is missing, it will be marked by -6999;(2) eliminate the moments with duplicate records;(3) data that is obviously beyond the physical meaning or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked by red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) the format of date and time is uniform, and the date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2014-6-10-10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
Please refer to Li et al.(2013) for hydrometeorological network or site information, and Liu et al.(2011) for observation data processing.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2014年1月1日至2014年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网中游张掖湿地站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市国家湿地公园，下垫面是芦苇湿地。观测点的经纬度是100.4464E, 38.9751N，海拔1460m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速传感器架设在5m、10m处，风向传感器架设在10m处，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处；四个光合有效辐射仪分别架设在冠层上方和冠层内，冠层上方安装在6m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）、冠层内安装在0.25m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）高处，朝向正南。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm）(单位：摄氏度)、冠层上向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)和冠层下向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_D_up、PAR_D_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2014-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量即可进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估计蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为在灌溉农田中，当平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，采用Craig–Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区是一个人工绿洲，覆盖着玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）及其在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的比率，该实验是河西水文遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的阻碍。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次密集观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。针对绿洲-沙漠系统，仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置，以捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了密集观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可以在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域被先前的研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时也记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of how meteorological data is collected in arid regions to study evapotranspiration?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个例子，说明在干旱地区如何收集气象数据以研究蒸散发？
Example.AnswerEn: In arid regions, meteorological data is collected using automatic weather stations equipped with sensors to measure air temperature, humidity, wind speed, and radiation. For instance, in the HiWATER experiment, data was collected every 10 minutes using a setup that included eddy covariance systems for turbulent fluxes and four-component radiometers for radiation measurements.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，气象数据通过配备传感器的自动气象站进行收集，这些传感器用于测量空气温度、湿度、风速和辐射。例如，在HiWATER实验中，数据每10分钟收集一次，使用的设备包括用于湍流通量的涡度协方差系统和用于辐射测量的四分量辐射计。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert systems?
Example.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集多尺度生态水文数据时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A significant challenge in collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data is the poor availability of multiscale observations, which is crucial for understanding complex processes. The HiWATER experiment addresses this by using hierarchically nested scales and deploying a variety of instruments like eddy covariance towers and automatic meteorological stations across different landscapes.
Example.AnswerCn: 收集多尺度生态水文数据的一大挑战是多尺度观测的可用性较差，而这对于理解复杂过程至关重要。HiWATER实验通过使用分层嵌套的尺度，并在不同的景观中部署各种仪器，如涡度协方差塔和自动气象站，来解决这一问题。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics of the data collection methods used in hydrometeorological observations for oasis-desert interactions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 用于绿洲-沙漠相互作用的水文气象观测的数据收集方法的特点是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, network of eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, eco-hydrological sensors, energy fluxes, water vapor fluxes, carbon fluxes, auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation parameters, soil parameters, ground-based measurements, airborne remote sensing, LiDAR, thermal imagers
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 分层嵌套尺度的仪器网络，涡度相关塔网络，自动气象站，生态水文传感器，能量通量，水汽通量，碳通量，涉及水文气象的辅助数据，植被参数，土壤参数，地面测量，机载遥感，激光雷达，热成像仪。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What specific features are measured by the meteorological stations in the Heihe River Basin?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 黑河流域的气象站测量哪些具体特征？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'multi-scale observations' in the context of eco-hydrological studies?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态水文学研究的背景下，“多尺度观测”是指在不同空间和时间尺度上进行的观察和测量。这种方法可以帮助研究人员理解生态系统和水文过程之间的相互作用，以及它们在不同尺度上的变化和影响。
Definition.AnswerEn: Multi-scale observations refer to the data collection strategy that involves capturing eco-hydrological processes at various spatial and temporal scales. This approach is crucial for understanding complex interactions in heterogeneous landscapes, such as oasis-desert systems, and often involves the use of hierarchically nested instruments to gather comprehensive datasets.
Definition.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测是指一种数据收集策略，涉及在不同的空间和时间尺度上捕捉生态水文过程。这种方法对于理解异质景观中复杂的相互作用（如绿洲-沙漠系统）至关重要，通常涉及使用分层嵌套的仪器来收集全面的数据集。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems compare with those used for monitoring evapotranspiration using the TSEB model?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，生态水文过程的数据收集方法与使用TSEB模型监测蒸散发的方法相比，如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The data collection methods for eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems involve multiscale observations with instruments like eddy covariance towers and automatic meteorological stations, capturing interactions in various landscapes. In contrast, monitoring evapotranspiration using the TSEB model focuses on ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures and involves thermal infrared imaging and radiometric temperature validation.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 生态水文过程在绿洲-沙漠系统中的数据收集方法涉及多尺度观测，使用涡度协方差塔和自动气象站等仪器，捕捉不同景观中的相互作用。相比之下，使用TSEB模型监测蒸散发则侧重于地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度，并涉及热红外成像和辐射温度验证。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods employed for the hydrometeorological observations ensure accuracy and reliability in heterogeneous landscapes?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 用于水文气象观测的数据收集方法如何确保在异质景观中的准确性和可靠性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The data collection methods involve a comprehensive setup of stations with various sensors positioned at different heights and depths to capture diverse hydrometeorological parameters. Quality control measures include ensuring consistent data entries, removing duplicates, and filtering out physically implausible readings. This multi-layered approach is designed to handle the complexity and variability inherent in heterogeneous landscapes, such as the oasis-desert systems.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法涉及在不同高度和深度设置多个站点，配备各种传感器，以捕捉多样的水文气象参数。质量控制措施包括确保数据条目的一致性、删除重复数据以及过滤不符合物理规律的读数。这种多层次的方法旨在处理异质景观（如绿洲-沙漠系统）中固有的复杂性和变异性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways might the integration of multiscale data from remote sensing and ground-based observations enhance the understanding of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert areas?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 多尺度数据的整合，包括遥感和地面观测，如何增强对绿洲-沙漠地区生态水文过程的理解？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Integrating multiscale data allows for a comprehensive understanding of eco-hydrological processes by capturing both large-scale patterns and localized phenomena. Remote sensing provides spatial coverage and temporal consistency, while ground-based observations offer detailed insights into specific environmental variables. This combination can improve model accuracy and offer more robust predictions of water, energy, and carbon exchanges in complex landscapes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 整合多尺度数据可以全面理解生态水文过程，捕捉大尺度模式和局部现象。遥感提供了空间覆盖和时间一致性，而地面观测则提供了对特定环境变量的详细洞察。这种结合可以提高模型的准确性，并为复杂景观中水、能量和碳交换的更稳健预测提供支持。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging due to several factors, including the incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy. Errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature can also lead to overestimation of component temperatures, affecting model performance. Additionally, the strong advective environment in these regions adds complexity to accurate estimations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量面临诸多挑战，包括可用能量与能量平衡闭合的不完整性。表面复合辐射温度所确定的表层土壤和植被组分温度的误差也可能导致组分温度的高估，从而影响模型性能。此外，这些地区强烈的平流环境增加了准确估计的复杂性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges of maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems for sustainable development?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间平衡的挑战因素有哪些，以实现可持续发展？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems for sustainable development is challenged by ecological degradation, such as the drying of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, and intensification of land desertification. These issues are exacerbated by climatic changes and human activities, particularly in inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas, which are crucial for ecological and socioeconomic stability.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡以实现可持续发展面临生态退化的挑战，例如河流和湖泊的干涸、自然植被的退化以及土地沙漠化的加剧。这些问题因气候变化和人类活动而加剧，特别是在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域，这些地区对生态和社会经济稳定至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to develop multiscale datasets for studying eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在研究绿洲-沙漠地区的生态水文过程时，开发多尺度数据集的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Developing multiscale datasets is important because it addresses the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces, which is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. These datasets allow for the capture of multi-scale eco-hydrological processes through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, which can provide a comprehensive understanding of oasis-desert interactions and support ecological stability and sustainable development.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 开发多尺度数据集非常重要，因为它解决了在异质表面上对生态水文过程进行上尺度处理的挑战，而这一挑战受到多尺度观测稀缺的制约。这些数据集通过在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器测量，能够捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程，从而提供对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的全面理解，并支持生态稳定性和可持续发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What goals drive the use of high-resolution thermal cameras and isotope techniques in estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 高分辨率热像仪和同位素技术在估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发时驱动的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal of using high-resolution thermal cameras and isotope techniques in estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration is to improve the validation of these processes by providing accurate soil and canopy component temperatures. This approach allows for better separation and estimation of soil and vegetation component temperatures, enhancing the accuracy of evapotranspiration modeling in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪和同位素技术来估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散的目标是通过提供准确的土壤和冠层组分温度来改善这些过程的验证。这种方法可以更好地分离和估算土壤和植被组分的温度，从而提高在强烈对流灌溉农业区域中蒸散建模的准确性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is there a focus on long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么要关注绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期观测？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: There is a focus on long-term observations because these data are crucial for understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems. This understanding is significant for achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, supporting the ecological security and socioeconomic development of oases, and recognizing oasis–desert interactions to protect ecological stability.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 长期观测受到重视，因为这些数据对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的基本特征至关重要。这种理解对于实现碳达峰和碳中和的目标、支持绿洲的生态安全和社会经济发展，以及认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用以保护生态稳定性具有重要意义。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can data processing ensure the quality of meteorological and hydrological observations in an oasis-desert system?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 数据处理如何确保绿洲-沙漠系统中气象和水文观测的质量？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control procedure involves data collection, processing, archiving, and sharing. Observational datasets consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes, as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters. Quality control is crucial and includes sensor calibration, data processing, and careful dataset generation. Data from automatic weather stations are averaged over a 10-minute period, and additional parameters such as soil and vegetation are supplemented to enhance data integrity.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序包括数据收集、处理、归档和共享。观测数据集由长期的能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量组成，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。质量控制至关重要，包括传感器校准、数据处理和仔细的数据集生成。自动气象站的数据以10分钟为单位进行平均，并补充土壤和植被等额外参数，以增强数据的完整性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are used to obtain and validate soil and canopy component temperatures in an irrigated agricultural area?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在灌溉农业区中，获取和验证土壤和冠层组件温度的程序有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Soil and canopy component temperatures are obtained using a high-resolution thermal camera mounted on a platform. Thermal images are captured approximately every 120 minutes during the daylight hours. The visible and NIR images are classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. The directional brightness temperatures are extracted from thermal images, and thermal infrared temperatures are converted to radiative temperatures using observed long-wave radiation and emissivities. The simulated radiometric temperatures are validated against surface radiometric temperatures recorded by a four-component radiometer.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 土壤和冠层组件的温度是通过安装在平台上的高分辨率热像仪获得的。热图像在白天每约120分钟捕获一次。可见光和近红外图像使用最大似然法分类为土壤和冠层像素。从热图像中提取方向亮度温度，并通过观测的长波辐射和发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。模拟的辐射温度与由四分量辐射计记录的表面辐射温度进行了验证。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are multiscale eco-hydrological processes captured in a heterogeneous surface using remote sensing and ground observations?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何通过遥感和地面观测捕捉异质表面中的多尺度生态水文过程？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Multiscale eco-hydrological processes are captured using a hierarchically nested observational system. This involves installing eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations. Additionally, an eco-hydrological sensor network measures soil moisture and leaf area index. Remote sensing is conducted using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer. These observations are complemented by synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. The collected data are carefully quality controlled and made available through data centers.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 多尺度生态水文过程通过分层嵌套的观测系统进行捕捉。这涉及安装涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站。此外，生态水文传感器网络测量土壤湿度和叶面积指数。遥感使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计进行。这些观测通过同步的地面测量来补充，测量植被动态和光合作用过程。收集的数据经过仔细的质量控制，并通过数据中心提供。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions and technological setups enable the accurate measurement of evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件和技术设置能够在异质景观中准确测量蒸散发？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The accurate measurement of evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes is enabled by using a combination of ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, high-resolution thermal cameras, eddy covariance systems, and stable isotope techniques, as well as a comprehensive setup of meteorological parameters measured at specific heights and frequencies.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中，准确测量蒸散发可以通过结合地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度、高分辨率热成像相机、涡度协方差系统和稳定同位素技术，以及在特定高度和频率下测量的全面气象参数设置来实现。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does the integration of multiple observation scales enhance the understanding of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 多个观测尺度的整合如何增强对绿洲-沙漠系统中生态水文过程的理解？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of multiple observation scales enhances the understanding of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems by employing hierarchically nested scales, which include a sparse network of various landscape observations, superstations, EC towers, AMSs, and high-resolution airborne remote sensing missions. This setup captures multi-scale data critical for studying interactions and processes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 多重观测尺度的整合通过采用分层嵌套尺度，增强了对绿洲-沙漠系统中生态水文过程的理解。这些尺度包括稀疏的各种景观观测网络、超级站、EC 塔、AMS 以及高分辨率的空中遥感任务。该设置捕获了对研究相互作用和过程至关重要的多尺度数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What are the technological and methodological advancements that facilitate long-term data collection in arid and semi-arid regions for energy and water vapor exchange studies?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 促进干旱和半干旱地区能源和水汽交换研究的长期数据收集的技术和方法学进展有哪些？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Long-term data collection in arid and semi-arid regions for energy and water vapor exchange studies is facilitated by advancements such as the use of eddy covariance systems, automatic weather stations with frequent measurement intervals, and comprehensive datasets involving hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters. These technologies and methodologies ensure robust data collection and quality control over extended periods.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，长期数据收集用于能量和水汽交换研究得益于技术的进步，例如使用涡度协方差系统、具有频繁测量间隔的自动气象站，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的综合数据集。这些技术和方法确保了在较长时间内的数据收集和质量控制。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the effectiveness of data collection methods be limited in arid regions when measuring evapotranspiration?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区测量蒸散发时，数据收集方法的有效性可能受到限制的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The effectiveness of data collection methods in arid regions can be limited due to difficulties in measuring evaporation and transpiration on the ground. Errors in image classification and uncertainties in estimating component temperatures from surface radiometric temperature can contribute to this limitation.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，数据收集方法的有效性可能受到限制，因为在地面上测量蒸发和蒸腾存在困难。图像分类中的错误以及从表面辐射温度估计组成温度的不确定性可能会加剧这一限制。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenge of observing energy and carbon exchanges in oasis-desert ecosystems over long periods?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在沙漠绿洲生态系统中，长期观察能量和碳交换的挑战因素有哪些？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Observing energy and carbon exchanges in oasis-desert ecosystems over long periods is challenging due to ecological degradation issues such as drying rivers and lakes and land desertification. These factors, along with the need for comprehensive and continuous data collection involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, contribute to the complexity of obtaining reliable long-term observations.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，长期观察能量和碳交换是具有挑战性的，因为生态退化问题，如河流和湖泊干涸以及土地沙漠化。这些因素，加上需要涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的全面和持续的数据收集，增加了获得可靠长期观察的复杂性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do researchers evaluate the effectiveness of data collection methods in capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 研究人员如何评估数据收集方法在捕捉多尺度生态水文过程中的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Researchers evaluate the effectiveness of data collection methods by implementing instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, using a combination of intensive observation periods and continuous hydrometeorological observations. This approach allows for capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes and addressing the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 研究人员通过在分层嵌套尺度上实施仪器，评估数据收集方法的有效性，结合密集观察期和连续的水文气象观测。这种方法能够捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，并解决多尺度观测可用性差的问题。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don’t understand how data quality control is maintained during the collection of meteorological data in such diverse environments.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在如此多样的环境中，如何在气象数据收集过程中保持数据质量控制。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data quality control is maintained by ensuring consistent data collection intervals (every 10 minutes), marking missing data with specific indicators, removing duplicate or non-physically plausible data, and using a uniform format for date and time. Additionally, sensor calibration and careful data processing steps are employed to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据质量控制通过确保一致的数据收集间隔（每10分钟一次）、用特定指示符标记缺失数据、删除重复或不符合物理规律的数据，以及使用统一的日期和时间格式来维护。此外，还采用传感器校准和仔细的数据处理步骤，以确保准确性和可靠性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore different methods for quality control and data processing in the collection of hydrometeorological datasets over heterogeneous land surfaces, including potential challenges faced in arid and semi-arid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在异质土地表面收集水文气象数据集时的质量控制和数据处理的不同方法，包括在干旱和半干旱地区面临的潜在挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection and quality control methods include ensuring a consistent data format, removing physically implausible data, and marking questionable data. Challenges in arid regions include image classification errors due to vegetation abundance, resulting in component temperature estimation errors, and atmospheric factors affecting temperature estimations.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据收集和质量控制方法包括确保数据格式一致、去除物理上不合理的数据以及标记可疑数据。在干旱地区的挑战包括由于植被丰富导致的图像分类错误，从而导致成分温度估计错误，以及影响温度估计的气象因素。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify and analyze potential strategies for enhancing the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimation models using ground-based and remote sensing observations in oasis-desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别和分析利用地面观测和遥感观测提高绿洲-沙漠生态系统蒸散发估算模型准确性的潜在策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Strategies for enhancing accuracy include using a two-source energy balance model with soil and canopy component temperatures obtained through ground-based measurements and high-resolution thermal cameras. Accurate separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures is crucial for improving model performance, as errors can arise from misclassification of pixels and atmospheric conditions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 提高准确性的策略包括使用双源能量平衡模型，通过地面测量和高分辨率热成像相机获取土壤和冠层组分温度。准确分离土壤和植被组分温度对于提高模型性能至关重要，因为错误可能源于像素的误分类和大气条件的影响。
